metadata.title: CVE-2023-34326 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: The caching invalidation guidelines from the AMD-Vi specification(48882—Rev 3.07-PUB—Oct 2022) is incorrect on some hardware, as deviceswill malfunction (see stale DMA mappings) if some fields of the DTE areupdated but the IOMMU TLB is not flushed. Such stale DMA mappings can pointto memory ranges not owned by the guest, thus allowing access to unindentedmemory regions.

criterions.comment: xen: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
